attributes.action: Give us a Referendum to Scrap and Decommission the Scottish Parliament
attributes.additional_details:
Devolution has
1. Divided the nation.
2. Consistently damaged Scotland’s image as a safe place to invest and do business by continually creating uncertainty about Scotland’s future political and currency model. 
3. Lacked ambition and failed to deliver what was intended with education, transport and capital projects eg. “rest and be thankful” tunnel.
attributes.background: The Scottish people never envisaged an failing intolerant one party state when they voted for devolution in 1997. Devolution has failed. The cost of the devolved administration is not justified. Westminster must set a question and offer the opportunity to reverse that decision.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333012
